title: How to Use the Search Bar on Pluto TV

steps.title: Open the Pluto TV app on your streaming device.
steps.content: Open the Pluto TV app on your streaming device. The icon will have the Pluto TV logo with a black background. Pluto TV is available on streaming devices such as: Smart TVs, Apple TV , Chromecast , Amazon Fire TV, PlayStation, Xbox, and Roku. [1] X Research source You'll be able to locate the Pluto TV app in your device's app library.

steps.title: On your device's remote, press the Select button.
steps.content: On your device's remote, press the Select button. This will vary depending on your device. On TV remotes, this will be the center button. On PlayStation controllers, this will be the X button.

steps.title: Select On Demand.
steps.content: Select On Demand . This will be located to the right of the Live TV tab. By default, your app will be on the Live TV tab.

steps.title: Press Select on your remote or navigate down.
steps.content: Press Select on your remote or navigate down. You will now be in the On Demand tab.

steps.title: Navigate to the far left section.
steps.content: Navigate to the far left section. You'll need to bypass the section that contains your Watch List .

steps.title: Click Search.
steps.content: Click Search . This will be next to a magnifying glass icon. Search can be found above your Profile .

steps.title: Type your search.
steps.content: Type your search. You can search for specific movies, channels, genres, and more.

steps.title: Press Select to input your search.
steps.content: Press Select to input your search.

steps.title: View your results.
steps.content: View your results. You'll see your results in a list. Scroll up and down to navigate your results. Available shows will have the tag On Now . You'll see On Demand , Live , and Later results. Results marked as Later will show you the time at which the show or movie will play.

steps.title: Open the Pluto TV app on your mobile device.
steps.content: Open the Pluto TV app on your mobile device. The icon has the Pluto TV logo with a black background. [2] X Research source If needed, you can download from the App store or download from the Google Play store . If you don't have the Pluto TV app on your homepage, you can access it through your device's app library.

steps.title: Click Search on the bottom right corner.
steps.content: Click Search on the bottom right corner. This will be next to a magnifying glass icon.

steps.title: Click the search bar.
steps.content: Click the search bar. Your device's keyboard should pop up.

steps.title: Input your search.
steps.content: Input your search. You can search for specific movies, channels, genres, and more. You don't need to press Enter or Return . Searches will load as you type.

steps.title: View your results.
steps.content: View your results. You'll see your results in a list. Scroll up and down to navigate your results. Available shows will have the tag Watch Now in yellow. You'll see On Demand , Live , and Later results. Results marked as Later will show you the time at which the show or movie will play.

steps.title: On your desktop browser, head to the Pluto TV website.
steps.content: On your desktop browser, head to the Pluto TV website. Pluto TV is free to use. If you have an account, you can log in at the top-right corner. You can also download the Pluto TV PC/Mac desktop app. [3] X Research source If you have a Pluto TV account, you'll be able to receive updates on the latest shows and movies coming to Pluto TV. You'll also be able to sync your watchlist and favorites across all your devices.

steps.title: Click Search at the top.
steps.content: Click Search at the top. This will be next to a magnifying glass icon.

steps.title: Input your search.
steps.content: Input your search. You can search for specific movies, channels, genres, and more. You don't need to press Enter or Return . Searches will load as you type. Some searches may take a few minutes to load.

steps.title: View your results.
steps.content: View your results. You'll see your results in a list. Scroll up and down to navigate your results. Available shows will have the tag Watch Now in yellow. You'll see On Demand , Live , and Later results. Results marked as Later will show you the time at which the show or movie will play.
